edu.berkeley.atdp.java.game.pong
Class PongGame

java.lang.Object
  edu.berkeley.atdp.java.game.GameObject
      edu.berkeley.atdp.java.game.pong.PongGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
PongTester
public class PongGame
extends GameObject

The entry point for pong games. It has an array of nonplayable characters, an array of playable characters, and a GamePanel which displays the state of the GameObject to the user.

Author:
Jonathan Berney

Constructor Detail

PongGame

public PongGame()
Constructor that creates a new PongGame with default values for its fields. This constructor is used for sending dummy clones to PaddleLogic objects for evaluation.

Parameters:

width - the initial width of the JFrame.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Creates a new PongGame, with PaddleLogic class names specified by args from the command line. If not enough PaddleLogic classes are supplied, the remaining spots are filled by the Wobbly PaddleLogic.

Parameters:
args - String array representing the names of the classes to be used for the Paddles' PaddleLogics.
